O1_YzZOJD01KTHN1ik1pOw.text: As always, looking to try new things, I bought a Groupon for this place and made it a date night. Fairly busy for a Thursday at 5, we were seated pretty quickly. We were received by a fly around the table, and the server joked that there's always one in that corner.   We had some delicious cocktails and the Loaded Green Chile Fries appetizer, which were really good; this was promising to be a good dinner. And then it went downhill.  We waited for a while for our entree, and that's where we were extremely disappointed; my fiance's Gumbo was bland, and the shrimp he paid extra as an add-on was chewy. I got the Salmon with Garlic mash; over cooked and bland. I had asked for a second cocktail while waiting for the meal which I never got, and halfway through my meal the server came to tell me they ran out of one of the main ingredients, and if I wanted anything else. I opted for water that took a long time to come without ice. All the while the fly was around us...   My recommendation: come during Happy Hour and get drinks and appetizers while listening to nice live music, but don't waste money on the main dishes.

GcYRlamysCpTBCbUiMh4sA.text: So, reservations made well in advance for a party of approx 20 guests for my sister in laws birthday celebration. We arrive at our 11 am reservation time. We are seated on the patio with a great view of the water. The location is really nice. Now, location does not necessarily make everything else great , in particular the service.  Initially first things I noticed were no silverware on the tables. The time we waited to even order drinks was a bit long but that's OK people are still arriving. We finally received our drinks and at that time orders were placed approximately 35-40 minutes after 11 AM. Our waitress whom I was informed was new to this establishment did not seem very sure of herself and disorganized, but maybe it was her first job so I can't put it all on her.  Now, it has been an hour since everyone ordered and still no explanation when our meals would arrive. I was told by the waitress, "soon." Soon came and went and now we are at 90 minutes since orders were placed. I approached an employee inside,  whom I believe was the lead busboy. I again asked what the delay could be with our order and he explained that the chef was out of town. Now am not a chef, or, privy to the goings-on in the kitchen but I'm sure he's not the only chef on the payroll. This employee I had spoken with, (lead busboy?) came to me and told me that the manager would soon be over to talk with us regarding the delays and our displeasure with the service so far. This manager we were expecting to see never appeared throughout the entire time of our penance there.   To summarize the service was terrible. Not everyone even received their meals that we're ordered, even after the two hour wait!? There was a discount of 25% for the meals but, there was an ad on of 20% for their "quality service?"  No one ever explained to us any reason why our food was late. At the minimum the manager should've come and addressed our table and explain the situation so that we were all informed instead of making up our own assumptions and trying to find out piece by piece from various employees wandering about the establishment. Just excuses.... terrible experience for all of us, especially my sister in law whom was the reason we all came to celebrate her birthday.  If you still decide to go to this place and " try your luck," I recommend sit at the bar. This will help ease your pain. You've been warned...

qW4oKY58MCU6BPycYipMWw.text: I like the location but over the last two years we have tried to Eat there 4 or 5 times. Each time they are either out of things on their menu or what comes out is not as described.  Last night my sandwich comes out without the guac on it as it says on the menu. Then when I mention it, she takes it back to the kitchen to have it re made but they bring the same one back with a side of guac, the guac was soupy like out of a package.  This was a$15 sandwich, so when I say I don't want it, they offer nothing. We had to ask them to remove it from the bill. First they removed the charge for a$5 beer.  We had to ask them to remove the sandwich which they did reluctantly. Moral of the story is, go for drinks and the view but skip eating there. The little outside venue next door is very good. Pier 54  I think it's called.

nk8SazF28jm4llBovj5oIA.text: it was my first experience at the watershed and can't complain about anything. Reservations are a must at this place but totally understand due to the capacity of the kitchen (was told this by hostess). Tried the strawberry puree with vodka drink and it was amazing! my entree consisted of the green chile bacon burger and it had a great grilled flavor. I am not sure what the other reviewers are complaining as everyone was nothing but friendly and service time was decent. would go back again!

wkV6xvo7Uyq30d5wwa1VLg.text: While the view at The Watershed is lovely, sadly my experience was not. We came on a Tuesday night and the restaurant was pretty empty, yet there was no one to seat us, no one to take our order, and we waited awhile for our food and checks.   My friend and I both ordered glasses of wine - she ordered a 9 ounce glass and I ordered a six. However, when our glasses came the pours were the exact same. We're still not sure if we got six or nine ounce pours.   I had the Southwest Salad and it was average at best. The dressing was described on the menu as a cilantro lime vinaigrette but it was really just a cup of olive oil.   Our waitress was always nowhere to be found, which is surprising considering there was maybe two or three other tables in the restaurant.   The bathrooms had an off putting smell and there was no trash can so all of the paper towels were being piled up by the sink.   They do have an extensive cocktail list, so in the future we may just come to enjoy the view and sip on a drink.

mBRMQv2F_F_rKYijJEMLdw.text: We came for Mother's Day brunch since we have come for happy hour before and loved it- at $48 a person for brunch and THEY dish it up- made the lines to get food ridiculously long! They offered two seating times- 11 and 2 - but waited to seat everyone at the same time! Staggering your seat times would have eliminated the long lines for food and they weren't ready at 11 to serve anyway! The food was cold and because they dished it up for you- it made it hard to go back for only items you wanted more of because the lines were so long! Allowing people to dish up from both sides of the table would get people through quicker- It was clear they wanted to monitor the expensive food!! My husband got one slice of cold steak and he said it was bland- No salt/pepper on the tables until we were nearly finished and no hot sauce for the eggs...We had to pay extra for mimosas- at $48 for a one time through buffet, they could have at least thrown in the mimosas for free or limited cost! 18% gratuity added automatically made the servers not really care if we were happy- total rip off- I'd never do that again! There are too many other places to choose from - The views are gorgeous- but not at that price

photos.caption: Photo of The Watershed - Tempe, AZ, United States. Check the price out!! $45 for all this AND bottomless mimosas!! Such a better option over Watershed!
Photo of The Watershed - Tempe, AZ, United States. Made to order omelets and pancakes! Imagine that- hot food! Rita&#39;s Kitchen At Camelback Inn
Photo of The Watershed - Tempe, AZ, United States. The pastries were great! Lots of pastry choices at Rita&#39;s Kitchen- much better brunch at less money

M2-OC4PvrObvujFmJIuJhQ.text: Loved the patio and a great view of the lake. Our server forgot about us and disappeared but giving her the benefit of the doubt we were the only table outside at this time. After reading some reviews it doesn't seem to be a rare occasion that some of the servers tend to forget about tables. If you're going, plan sit on patio otherwise inside is average.

photos.caption: Photo of The Watershed - Tempe, AZ, United States. Patio

7hX1wKeNX1ALFpPT54ujQg.text: I wanted to like this place since it looked beautiful and spacious. Unfortunately, we will never go back. Service was inattentive and very slow (Food was served after TWO hours!! and not all at once) Food was over priced for what you get and taste was nothing exceptional.  I'm pretty flexible and understanding when you see a restaurant busy and the staff doing all they can,  but this was not the case. The place was basically empty and we had to track staff down to ask for straws drink refills and updates on our food. Salt and pepper were not even on the tables. The venue is beautiful, very sad that the service and food don't even come close to measuring up. I would not recommend.

KpWU_4Y4tBh_gE1IbAsClg.text: Food was great and Ken the waiter was very knowledgeable and courteous.  A nice evening.

CvW_g0REcuxFu_57GdPlXQ.text: I will admit I was a little concerned given some of the reviews but we had a wonderful experience!  Our waiter was very friendly and attentive and we received our food and drinks in a very timely manner.  I had the Greek Penne Pasta with the pan seared salmon.  It was absolutely delicious.  We sat outside on the patio which has a very pretty view overlooking the lake.  We will definitely be back.

wsxQCdK2GlWZAPzRU9Dqdg.text: Wife and I went to this restaurant for lunch yesterday.  I had the beef tacos and she the pork sandwich.   It was their signature dish.  For a signature this it was not good. It want freshly made. Seemed like a frozen paddie.  Some guys were at the bar dropping f-bombs which I don't mind but when the bar keep drops them, as he did.  Not good.  The tacos were ok but so overpriced. Save your money and taste buds and go elsewhere

9qP04kmI4TYgP_5pc_Teug.text: Took a friend here last night for a drink for his birthday. Neither one of us are from the area so it was hard to pick a place. But this was close to his hotel so we went for it. We are both relatively quiet and low-key people. I was pleasantly surprised by how quiet it was on a Friday night. Also, I was shocked when 2 vodka drinks was $11! I live on the east coast and 1 vodka drink is usually $15! The music wasn't too loud, the bartender and staff were friendly, the vodka was too notch and the atmosphere is amazing. Right on a lake and the outdoor patio was stunning. I will definitely be returning here during my next trip to Phoenix!

uvClrW1saQ2Xea2Lnx6aYA.text: Had a good experience here despite some previous reviews, and the food was delicious.  We were told that they have only been open 4 months, so there is still some training going on, but our service was excellent.  I ordered the chicken enchiladas which were very good (with a True NM green chile sauce).  Also had several Hurricanes on happy hour - very tasty and "effective" ;)  We sat on the patio on the afternoon with a little wind and the umbrellas are not weighted down, so be careful that they don't fall on you.  Our server noted he's told management several times but nothing has been done - a little disheartening to hear a safety issue with a simple fix has fallen on deaf ears from employees.

nAxhZ-DLCAWk2R0b9iQtQg.text: My wife and I joined a group of coworkers last night for an informal dinner gathering. The atmosphere is INCREDIBLE! Beautiful patio, beautiful view, corn hole games, darts, billiards and a great menu. I am not sure if our group overwhelmed the staff, but we had a few big misses in service. Incredibly friendly staff, but just struggled to get things correct. Meals were incorrect for a few of our party. Solutions were so slow that we passed on a couple of the efforts (like missing chicken on the chicken nachos...the chicken was brought out nearly 30 minutes after we reported the missing key ingredient). Another member ordered a salmon salad and when all the meals were delivered we were told they didn't have any salmon. Another meat was selected and then 15 minutes later a salad arrived with a big junk of salmon on top....weird. Prices were HIGH too! Those nachos with no chicken were $13. Anyways, go for a nice spot to get drinks but don't expect the execution in the kitchen to match the scenery.

gOEPB2BFkMiv96STl6Padg.text: Just Horrible. Save yourself the trip and stay away. The food was slow, mediocre, and we (along with others it appeared) received absolutely horrendous service by every single staff member there, including the manager. We stopped in for a "quick" bite with our kids, when we tried to put an order in after our server finally showed up having already been waiting for over 15 min at a table, the appetizer never came.... we waited another 10-15 min to receive waters, and then finally had the opportunity to order our meal only to wait another 45min for the incomplete food order.... The completely ineffectual manager awkwardly came to apologize for our crappy experience... only he never actually did apologize.... He gave an excuse of being understaffed, which might explain the slow service, but not the poor attitude  from the nearly non-existent service. This place is a waste of an amazing location. I feel robbed of my time and my money, I will not be back, and I will tell pretty much everyone to stay away. Like all the places before it.... this one appears to be another bust.

YX9sjDIWyRV0CrrHxG2uDg.text: Cool, new place. Went here for the first time for a friend's birthday gathering. Plenty of space, good food and drinks, excellent waitstaff, and an awesome location. Reminds me of being up north on lake. We will be visiting again.

zZbrNREw_JbV4yC2CsUUrQ.text: Just got home from the watershed an we would certainly go back. Service was decent, we just had to wait some for a bit to get the check. Our only real issue was the fact that both our dishes , the Greek salmon penne and the grilled shrimp pasta were both a little burned on the shrimp and salmon portion, other than that the pasta on both dishes was good, the view was great and drinks were good as well

8B5Rdl5_9jWhn_5PGOoYDw.text: We came here last night for a work happy hour. The view of the lake is absolutely beautiful and the atmosphere is great. They have a huge bar with a good selection of draft beers, scotch, and mixed drinks. The staff is very friendly and helpful. My one complaint is that the appetizers need some work. We had the nachos which was very plain. We also had queso dip which after one minute on the table turned rock hard since it was just regular cheese just melted. We tried their chicken skewers which were pretty good. I can't comment on their main course dishes because I've only had apps but I've heard they are great. Overall I really like this place and will be returning!

Dda6V1KnnRaZ21yi_FD0FQ.text: Great view, hence the two stars. We went there about a dozen times over the last two years since the restaurant opened. The food was just below average at first at above average prices. After the novelty had worn off, we didn't go for a while until a few weeks ago. Unfortunately, the food got even worse, much worse. Won't go again unless there are dramatic changes to the quality of the food, the management, the menu, and the drinks (totally watered down). What a shame because the location and the view is great, and we live in walking distance. We are rooting for the Watershed, but the way it is right now, it is not worth going there.

Q4D_WTT71oxU3u9Dd_64Lg.text: Came here for Mother's Day Brunch. The food, service, and views were all amazing!! We sat on the patio. The drinks were great! I had the shrimp Diablo pasta... So good! After we took a boat ride it was so much fun and so relaxing! I would definitely come again!!

UNmQjpuBlBY7fG2Up4pjaA.text: Some girlfriends and I went here last night to celebrate some birthdays and we really enjoyed it.   The location is PRIME!   We couldn't enjoy the outside deck because of the 110 temps, but the lake view was beautiful.   The servers in the bar and at our final table were awesome, and the GM was very entertaining (he came over and was doing magic tricks for us).  I'd have to agree that the food wasn't the greatest, but we will be back.

hVdnzfNRMRt2odjPd1T4zA.text: Yes ...the first time I stopped in ,I ordered the half rack of ribs and I must admit they were finger lick'n good....My second time I took a date ....Now they use Ipod phones to place your order which is cool....unless the system goes down, now I must say they were on it realized the problem and took care of our order ....Made up for the wait by giving us free dessert ....They also offer "Live Entertainment" which is a plus ....So you can enjoy the best of both worlds and you won't  brake the bank....We will go back and tell our friends

DzeMolDE9Rg_ubKPYDKANw.text: Though still in the midst of a renovation the interior was organized, clean and one can see the potential finished product will look amazing. Friendly staff, outstanding view from the patio : complete with adorable ducks and nearby residents in kayaks paddling by.  I was underwhelmed by their vegetarian options but thats nothing new to me. I scoped out their grilled cheese and a side of fries. My mom got the red chile salad w shrimp. Our server was quick, friendly and kept our glasses topped off which I always appreciate.  The food came out within 10 minutes. Perfectly presented, and i really have to say it: for a grilled cheese w fries it was Beautiful. Perfectly done. And the taste! Out of this world. I haven't had a meal exceed my expectations like this grilled cheese did in a long time! They use some amazing herbs and the cheese blend is fantastic!  Fries were Cajun spicy! Addictive! Ma's salad was fantastic, the grilled shrimp perfectly grilled and marinated. Her words: "i would eat this again for dinner tonight if I could."   Bread pudding for desert! Don't even get me started! You'll just have to go there and experience it for yourself. 5 stars. Will be back and with those super reasonable prices it'll be sooner rather than later!

K5eYEkJzjBrJDGRcdS-Sww.text: We went to Tempe's newest lake view restaurant a few weeks ago with a large group and enjoyed the patio at the picnic table area. We went for Happy Hour, but they currently only have drink specials, no food specials. Would be nice if they have some food specials to keep up with what other places are doing for h.h. $1  off beer & specialty cocktails and $5 house cocktails and wine. Hours for Happy Hr. are 3pm to 6pm, T-F. We had the cobb salad for $13. which was good, but was advertised as having jalapeno buttermilk ranch dressing and I expected a little spice from it, there was no spice at all. Tasted just like ranch. We also had the burger which was $10. and came with a choice of toppings and a side like fries. I think there were other choices of sides, but I can't recall now. The server was friendly and gave us separate checks,which is a must in a large group!  The view is nice as it is on a lake and the "party" boats came out about sunset and was fun to watch all the boaters. The inside of the place is still under going renovations,but there is seating inside as well. There are quite a few steps to get to the patio, but there are a few ramps inside to get you to the patio. The inside bar looks like a great place when they finish with it.  I will be back soon, but probably will eat inside as the weather in the Phoenix area is heating up. The place was quite busy for mid week at 4:30pm,we wanted the area with backs to the chairs,but the area was already full by the time we arrived.(patio)  Dan-please add some food happy hour specials.

gQ65LkT2E_kG4GGOutDeyQ.text: My wife and I decided to give this place a shot, I don't understand the negative reviews because we absolutely loved everything about this place. Our waiter was Ken, he was friendly, attentive, and offered excellent suggestions. The food was amazing and cocktails came in a nice presentation. I got the enchiladas and the Lakeshore martini. Great atmosphere, great service, romantic lighting, clean, food to die for, it was a little smokey but we were sitting outside not a big deal. All in all a lovely experience, we will definitely be back.

SIPcV0q9V9KGGPHwsH8u_A.text: Love the atmosphere and that was all!  I have never sent food or drink back at a restaurant but I had to here, it was not edible (meatloaf). The Margarita was straight mixer, not good. I could hear someone yelling towards the back, turns out the manager was screaming at employees! The server handled all the issues like a pro, which tells me she has to do it often.  really bummed, I wanted to love this place since its in walking distance of my home. Maybe go here just for a beer and the lake view.

7r1LzH_nEwq9cD3_qTHW2A.text: Isaiah is very knowledgeable and friendly. The hubs ordered chicken enchiladas that were amazing. I had old school pork tenderloin sandwich because it reminds me of Iowa. :) Apple slaw rocked and the space/atmosphere is lovely and full of various potential.

OTo1F2HZ94Q70p4B7IVZHQ.text: Incredible layout, great food & service! I highly recommend the panko crusted Fish & Chips! Fall is also perfect weather for a boat ride!

iPV0N3pl5JMFSlpLaLX1Xg.text: And it's a Packer Bar! Everything you ever wanted in a bar and restaurant.  A vast selection of ice cold craft beers, scrumptious appetizers, burgers and salads.  All in a room with a view.  Nothing more to ask for here, except to be served by Michael.  That long hair, bearded, pot bellied bartender is really is nice guy.  This time I mean it.  Sit back and enjoy the game! Aaron Rodgers is sorely missed.  The beer is still cold!

NXtzAG08I-58p2YLGwGCLw.text: Food was good. Really liked the music they were playing. Waterfront location is awesome, but they could use a little more shade on their patio. Server Aaron was cool and moved us from the main patio to a side one where it was shadier.

I8LEJTc8XJw318-0VTmSQQ.text: The Watershed is a great place. Whether it's for a drink with some friends to watch a game in the bar, a nice glass of wine on the lakeshore or a romantic dinner at sunset, this is the place. The staff are all very friendly and the manager Heather is always there making sure things run smoothly. Great happy hour place and prices. If you're looking for a cool lakeside spot in Tempe, this is it!

bhSqOtu-Ry205osYN4l9aQ.text: I came here today for brunch with a friend and her dog, we invited several others with their dogs. I didn't make reservations because of the number of people who are prone to flaking out at the last minute. From the start I found EVERYONE to be very accommodating and kind. A few in our group got a little bit pushy about meat in a breakfast burrito but our server Stephanie didn't flinch at all. She was very kind and made sure to make her guests happy. Beautiful setting right along the lake. Can't wait to come back for a special occasion.

ANZgP4XPmYXIOp5SAaCK-A.text: This place has an amazing atmosphere. Very nice without being over the top. They have pool tables and other things to entertain yourself with while you wait for food, and the Lakeside view is beautiful.   The staff is very friendly and down to earth. Ask for Aaron. He knows the menu and will tell you his honest opinion on the items. He also talks to you like another person and cares about your experience instead of acting like you're just another customer like most people do.   Definitely recommend this place. It's easy to miss, but you'd miss out not trying it!

cQcGQenw7bKCYlF7ylvXvA.text: We enjoyed a great Friday evening with a buddy here & listened to a guitar player who took requests.  Just about every seat has a good view of the lake. The patio books fast & we landed a window table with a view.  Happy Hour is from 3-6 Mon through Fri.  We had good quality wines for $5 & good chicken tacos & chicken flatbread for $5. This place has better happy hour foods compared to other restaurants.  Our server, Janice, was very professional & provided great suggestions.  Also, she let us know about the boat tours. She was attentive without being intrusive which is a rare quality.  BTW, boat tours are $5 per person.  Parking can be a challenge but don't be discouraged since a parking area next door is available.  With the great wine prices you might want to Uber or Lyft here.  Two thumbs up for the Watershed.

aLv_v-jHxFVqgIpcHp4EDA.text: Location, location, location. Then there is really good drinks like nowhere else. Service is fantastic. If your lucky the Manager may even pull a magic trick.   Try their infused Bloody Mary's and Margaritas.

photos.caption: Photo of The Watershed - Tempe, AZ, United States

VeqQFK7vGsE2obXKx6SQYg.text: We took some out of town relatives to the Watershed last weekend in the afternoon. We hadn't been there in some time.  We sat in the bar area.  Despite the fact that there were 3 staff members standing near the bar no one came to offer us service.  During our stay we had to go to the bar each time to get our own drinks...however the bartender did find time to bring our bill over on 2 occasions.  Our relatives ordered loaded baked potatoes costing nearly  $12.00....what they got were 4 halves of  the smallest driest potatoes I have ever seen! The taste was like cardboard!  The bar area looks like it should be on a dive bar tour.  Loose hanging wires all over the place.  The Watershed needs a knowledgeable manager that cares and/or an owner that is willing to spend a little money and elbow grease to class up the place.  The location is perfect in The Lakes with a fantastic view!  What a shame to look like this on the inside and provide this low level of service.  With only one dish ordered I cannot comment on the other food, although I will say that the menu looks like it came from an actual dive bar.  The bathroom was dirty and uncared for too.    Please fix this place up so we can be proud to take guests there again.

hDGTQdyoug5gIYBzt087VQ.text: Had a great reception here recently.  Sharmayne was very friendly, professional, and helpful.

LztjN6_splBPKfeLq-580A.text: Watershed was great. Went in on a Sunday afternoon. Food was delicious. they have boat rides and just do peaceful to enjoy a yummy lunch.

2gZvnmjZ6cI7gDaD_g6S9g.text: First time was actually a great place and great drinks and service. Beautiful views , best Kentucky mule

RL2f7DhqdgZvE5YUmdv9vA.text: The location of Watershed is unlike any other you will get in Arizona. It's on a lake! That's hard to find around there. Also, there's a ton of different places to sit! There's even a room with couches and a real fire place. However, our waitress wasn't the best. They weren't really busy, so I was confused why she never checked on us. The Bart we, Neli, she's super dope though! She took care of us because our waitress never came around. I love the Vibe of Watershed, though. Plus, they have super cool events like yoga and margaritas. Doesn't get any better than that.

3VJhioMXess2mzmESFhMKQ.text: Jeremy and Ryan were gracious hosts, somehow navigating a party of more than 30 people with ease and patience. The ambiance was pleasant, nice one man band playing old Zeppelin acoustics. Wide variety on the menu. Delicious food, views, comfortable seating. Overall an excellent experience. Highly recommend.

enPohFC9ndBStSqKrC-InQ.text: Awful!!!!. It could be a great place because it's very pretty.    There were 12 people in the place and we were told we had to wait 35  Minute wait because they didn't have staff.   This was our second visit. The first visit  isn't worth mentioning except for saying the Service was horrendous but we wanted to give it another shot!!!!

3pXcYFCP0sQFkdOk91qOvQ.text: Just ate here for the first time and it was excellent. I had the Seasonal Berry Salad with grilled chicken. All of the ingredients we so fresh and the portion size was very generous. My husband had the meatloaf and it was also great.   The view is amazing. They have a beautiful patio on the water. I would definitely recommend it even just for a relaxing drink in a perfect setting. If you prefer to sit inside the view is still very good.

FIeQs_0p7Ad9dOzP6DZwvA.text: This was our first visit and while the views and environment were very nice the food and service was extremely lacking.   Main issues: Dinner served cold, very slow wait staff  We don't planning on returning and can't recommend the Watershed in Tempe.

o70UPBSEtJxrqZuK13j29Q.text: On Sunday the hostess told us we had a choice between the buffet and ordering off the menu. However, our server, after being seated for quite a while, told us we could ONLY  choose the buffet. We should have left then but we didn't.  The service was slow and sporadic.  I ordered  coffee, first the coffee came out, then the Splenda, then the cream....all punctuated by long (all least 15 minutes) waits despite it being relatively empty. A Coke was no better, nor the iced tea. Then to the food......half of it was cold, the other part inedible.  There were scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage, pancakes, french toast strips, plus a variety of pastas, pork, Mexican dishes, etc....all either cold, congealed or inedible. Obviously, they are in search of the bar business and the food was secondary.  Won't be going back.

i011EkjYQHqcpwkI5OQBtQ.text: Love, love, love this place! The ambiance, the views, drinks, and food are amazing! Service is great too!! We'll keep coming back again and again!! We had the Stuffed Chicken Breast and the Shedhead Burger! Everything was cooked perfectly and delicious! Amazing place for parties and get togethers!!

gjYOpv44XCoUTDD8oxK5tA.text: We came here because they said the had a dog friendly patio. It was nice, a beautiful view. The service absolutely sucks. My husband and I owned an Italian restaurant in San Diego for 11 years. When we were super busy we ALWAYS greeted our customers with a smile. Not once did we get that.  We were told to go out to the patio and wait for our table. Ok, we ordered drinks that took 20 minutes at the bar to get. Meanwhile I sat outside with the dog. There were 5 empty tables, I finally saw the hostess who said that the place we were sitting someone else requested to sit there, she asked if we had our name on the list???? You took our name!!!! Basically  at that point we left.... They need to educate their staff on friendliness. Get a manager that cares and maybe it will run smoother. Never going back. Oh plus it smelled like rotten eggs.

-kGH7ykCi3yC-zuVpkMNYw.text: I'm really sad this place is disappointing, I live in the lakes neighborhood and it's a great idea to have a restaurant on the lake in our back yard.  Service is slow and servers aren't friendly or helpful. Such a waste and wish this place could get in the hands of better management

oRx64oToHXm8SNuDgfVtyQ.text: When my family moved to the Lakes community in 1977, I thought this lake-side restaurant was the coolest.  In fact, we owned a small sail boat, and when the wind was okay, I would sail in for a beer and appetizer.   Way cool.   Of course the restaurant has changed owners and themes many times since then. Some for better, some not.  The current theme of sports bar works all good with me.  I still like the place. And the food is okay, a little more expensive than most bar food. But we are also paying for the scenery.  Beautiful back in the day, beautiful now.  NOTE: Read my other numerous reviews for tips, entertainment, and historic references. Thank you, Tim B.

uwHuKh4RyxtMzu1ODT0N2Q.text: We thoroughly enjoyed our visit to the Watershed.  Overall good experience.  I'm actually surprised to see the reviews everyone else wrote as we did not have any issues with slowness, staff, or food.  There were very few things that this place is lacking.  My husband and I have already agreed we will go back again.  I cannot say if this is an everyday occurrence but at the day and time we came in. It was an older crowd, which was nice for us as we are older people.  The band that was playing was actually really great and we commented more than once on how good they were.  All of the servers seem very young which makes sense as the establishment is very close to the ASU campus.   Everyone was professional however and I was impressed to see such great service.  Overall feel is very laid back.  Definitely not a place you need to wear your Sundays finest but could if you wanted to.     Pros:  Great Food Menu Beautiful views of a lake Excellent Service  Live music every Friday Good beer selection Reasonable pricing Boat rides offered in the winter Good service Easy Parking  Cons: Older establishment.  Would be amazing with a few upgrades here and there.   Older AC system.  Definitely felt a little warm here and there throughout the evening  Mosquitoes on the patio

U5xSk15KnOSwMAbj8z0K4Q.text: """As of June 10th no one has reached out to me. That truly shows its only money. I hope someone who cares buys them out. Mothers Day Brunch. HORRIBLE! Please read the reviews. Management only cares about money. A party of 5. My mom 87. I wanted this to be a special day for her. So...i called Sunday after got home to complain, no one was available when we're leaving. Left voice mail. No return call. Sent email. Nothing. Called Tuesady. Nothing. Sent message on the web site-contact us. NOTHING. The food was not ready until 11:20. Had to WAIT to go through a buffet. The dessert and salad table had no plates. You had to break through the line to get one then come back. No salt and pepper which from reviews is normal and managment must not read. That could be an easy fix. No soup spoons. Had to ask 3 different people. Not all items posted on menus were put out. Oh wait...yeah they did they added meatloaf. Biscuits and gravy and chicken. To the end of line. You watched them set up a table add cloth then food . did they know the place was open at 11! And to not have it ready.UNACCEPTABLE. Had to WAIT IN A HORRIBLE LONG LINE ALL OVER AGAIN. I had been getting the food for my mom and by the time I got back she said she was done. The steak was rubbery and raw. Meat loaf had more mixed vegetables. Bland test. Brought water in paper cups. Charged for coffee!!! And I paid a grutuity for waiting in lines. Serving myself and our table. I should of gotten that! 5 adults. 4 coffee Bailey. I regular coffee. Plus charged for 1 boat ride. $367.12. Omgosh. Think where we could of went ANYWHERE. Had better food better service and had money left over. No one there cares. They will NOT be in business long. To many of the same reviews over and over. They are scamming all the first timers. DONT DO IT.DO NOT BE TRICKED INTO GOING HERE. Thanks for giving us such a horrible experience on Mothers Day. You should be ashamed.

ccqXYVT0FOy91n7a_-y3SA.text: Couples date night and we found this hidden gem!  Friday night offer reservations for 4 via Yelp and live music.  It's pretty laid back and the food was amazing.  We shared the calamari and it was delish.  I shared the fish tacos and the Lobster ravioli with crab meatballs with my husband and all I can say is: YUM!  Totally a great place and we will be back again soon! Our waitress was friendly and did a great job in her services!  And who doesn't love live-acoustic music!

photos.caption: Photo of The Watershed - Tempe, AZ, United States. Just enjoying a double date night for dinner!

Wx4C0-zZdaIEPUt0CykOuw.text: Unfortunately, the boat was broken down so we used the dessert option on our coupon.  We were able to enjoy the water views from our table.  The menu has so many good options.  I'm excited to take my son next time we visit.  This might be the only good thing in Tempe...lol (we're U of A fans).  My Cajun stroganoff was delicious, a little spice but not overwhelming.  Everyone ate every bite of their large portioned meals.  It was also difficult to choose dessert because there were so many options.  Our waiter was friendly and handsome, though he wasn't able to answer some of our menu questions.  It's a great atmosphere and a fun place to visit when missing the Midwest lakes while living in the desert.

photos.caption: Photo of The Watershed - Tempe, AZ, United States. Menu
Photo of The Watershed - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of The Watershed - Tempe, AZ, United States. Menu

CHmMkl6_uHER3OMIIjhy3w.text: Giving this place 2 stars only because I've been there but at the same time haven't been there I'll explain: made a reservation for two at 10 am the hostess was nice and had me in the system however I was informed that they only show the packers games here which is strange since they have a huge NFL Sunday ticket advertisement on the outside of the place and also promote this online.  On their website there is mention of special seating for packers fans but doesn't explain this fully. Also in my opinion that's poor business and extremely petty lol I assume the manager or owner only wants packer fans in his establishment but hey that's you're lost especially when there is other bars in the area that will gladly take the business of other NFL fans. Bottom line is this looks a great place to get some good food and drinks on a non football day unless you're a packers fan don't waste you're time coming here for the game. I recommend Dave and busters in Tempe they have huge screens everywhere and take everyone. I'll post another review once I actually eat at this place I travel a lot and live in California though.

DCe46pExsng57TY4XMDRfw.text: Worst experience on a Saturday night.  Our order was taken but our order was never put in to be cooked.  We waited over an hour to be told finally as we tried to leave that the waiter forgot to put our order in the system.  A few drinks on the house didn't take care of our hunger, horrible experience.

photos.caption: Photo of The Watershed - Tempe, AZ, United States. The watershed

zSfdXaWG2eGthEMX8pjL0g.text: Wow, had a birthday celebration with 15 guest, and  I must say I love this place. They were very accommodating and very friendly. I love the atmosphere of the whole place. Heather the manager was so helpful, we called to ask about reservations and she got right back to us, she checked on on us several times and just has a very nice demeanor about herself. Our waitress Leticia was also phenomenal very friendly and fast. The only reason I can't give this place a perfect score was because some of the food was a little dry and some other food cold. I would recommend a new chef. The scenery was soooo nice, I will be coming back. This may be my place.

NGy4a7yyirtY9lXjdfzmvQ.text: I really like this spot. Good for happy hour. They have great $5 drink specials. They no longer do deals on food but they have amazing range of food. Brunch is delicious here and you can beat the $15 bottle of mimosa. We have never actually done the boat ride but everyone always looks pleased with the ride around the lake. Downside here is parking but there is a lot next door which maybe easier that there actual parking lot.

photos.caption: Photo of The Watershed - Tempe, AZ, United States. Ravoli dish...good but needed more sauce. Taste better than it looks
Photo of The Watershed - Tempe, AZ, United States. Salmon dinner, good but salmon portion was small. Husband left hungry.
Photo of The Watershed - Tempe, AZ, United States. Happy Hour on the lake!

Ri_5Mje4JFxuc13zVW8itQ.text: I was excited to try their menu today!  We ordered drinks and our lunch then looked at the beautiful view of the lake.  35 minutes later our food had not arrived.  We asked a waitress (ours had disappeared). She said we were the second to  be served.  We checked table #1, they were still waiting for their food too (45mns into it).  We took off and had lunch elsewhere.  This place has serious staff issues.  We were disappointed and while the setting was very inviting it failed to deliver the essential: food!

photos.caption: Photo of The Watershed - Tempe, AZ, United States

PaujxGY6cgGZd_bpv2pQ-Q.text: SERVICE IS TERRIBLE!!!! Food was not anything phenomenal.. they actually tried to serve me a sandwich that appeared to have been sitting for a DAY or two.. I'm not exaggerating; cheese looked super old, wilted lettuce and hard, cold bread.. just garbage. Thankfully they made it right and brought me a fresh sandwich; WHAT a difference! We had to ask for our server multiple times and each time it took forever for her to arrive.   Anyway.. I was happy to be there with the awesome company i had and we were seated at a table with a GORGEOUS view. I just wish this place was better all around. I have zero intention of returning. I sincerely hope the best for the Watershed because the location is really beautiful. Best of luck.

wsk-Qfh-1_HkX2ygRbFeQA.text: Came here because the restaurant looked beautiful. Our waitress was very nice and attentive. However, when we got our steaks they were completely raw. We asked them to be cooked medium. We took the first bite before we knew this and could just taste the blood from the steak. Then we cut the steak right in half and notice it is completely RAW. The rice was undercooked and dry. It was just sad because we had a table by the lake we got to see the sunset which was beautiful but this totally ruined the dinner. I hope that this place is able to improve their food quality because everything else was pleasant.

photos.caption: Photo of The Watershed - Tempe, AZ, United States. Raw steak served

q47Qa-vtM_d_OrTF_CtoxQ.text: Prior to going to the Watershed I called and asked if reservations were needed and the answer was no. The moment I arrived, they had a sign saying "reservations only, sorry for the inconvenience"   I walked in and told Jasmine (the bartender) about my phone call and she said, "I'm sorry for the miscommunication but we will definitely let you in and you can ride the boat"   The purpose of this yelp review is to say thank you to her for making our day so good!!!

XOmg3-ic_uB2q2lLJMKqBg.text: Came here Friday night (5/11) at 5:30pm. The view and drinks were lovely but I can't recommend the food at all. We ordered the salmon plate based on a picture/review from a yelper on this page; it was terrible. The salmon and the accompaniments were dry. The clam chowder was bland and had no flavor. Lastly, the cheese curds would have been ok, but tasted mealy and were not fresh. We took a few bites of everything but it was not up to standards. The server and manager were great and listened to our concerns and did not charge us for the food. I wish the food was better because we loved the view, drinks, and live music.

photos.caption: Photo of The Watershed - Tempe, AZ, United States. Strawberry Fields drink and view

6HlNvE8CQiiTbwMlaatfpA.text: I really had hoped to love this spot. This is such a cool location in Tempe. It's too bad that the restaurant is utterly mismanaged. I took my mom and brother for dinner tonight and nearly every aspect of the service was poor. Host staff clearly had little experience in helping to accommodate someone in a wheelchair. I can understand this but then involve us in the process-we live this and can support you if the location is accessible.. EG. I could tell you a booth isn't ideal and rather a table with a chair removed is better. (This was after she lead us to a table outside that was only accessible by stairs. Nope. But we made the booth work although that meant helping my brother out of his chair and into the booth... leaving the chair in the aisle/pathway of food runners etc.   Wait staff was slow, didn't know the menu and then the poor guy had to return to our table no less than 3 times telling us either that he was mistaken about menu options and/or were out of that beer and that beer and that one too. It was a Saturday night, early... which suggests a lack of responsible inventory orders. Even after we ordered our drinks they took forever to arrive.   If we thought the wait for drinks was bad.... our meals took longer with absolutely no updates or communication. It took So long that we eventually got up to find the server and ask. "Oh the kitchen Is backed up." Yea I could've guessed that. The place had a fair number of active tables but it also wasn't packed. And at no point did any of the service staff appear to be under any pressure or urgency to be of service. And as a former server myself I know that when the kitchen is THAT backed up you check in and tell your tables, apologize and reassure them it'll be out as soon as possible. And at that point, managers step in and do some goodwill visits too. But none of that happened.   When the food finally arrived. It was fine, average. Nothing worth waiting the 40 + minutes. we had a pasta dish a sandwich and a quesadilla.... nothing requiring an extended grill time.   I give 2 stars bc the location is beautiful and has so much potential. And bc although the service was awful, our waiter seemed like a nice person. Simply a nice person with zero training or support from Mgmt. It's too bad bc the spot has so much potential. Very disappointing.

Z_n_xE7cl5J9ofvcyHSp1w.text: I've been here twice for brunch- and I'm really surprised by the mediocre reviews! Each time I've gotten excellent service, the food has been above average, and you can't beat the view. Most recently, I had the lunch chicken sandwich- it was good, a little dry, but well seasoned and it had a good crunch. It also came on the pillowiest brioche bun ever. The real star of the plate were the crunchiest fries I've ever had! They're good enough to eat as a meal on their own. My husband had the classic breakfast- eggs, breakfast potatoes, toast, and bacon. The bacon was super thick and perfectly crunchy, the potatoes seemed like they might be freezer potatoes but were still good, and the eggs were good as well. They also have an AMAZING deal for brunch where you get a bottle of sparkling wine and your choice of juice for mimosas and it's only $15!!! Take my advice-  go when it's nice outside, sit on the deck by the water, order the mimosa and the biggest plate of fries they'll give you.

photos.caption: Photo of The Watershed - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of The Watershed - Tempe, AZ, United States

ZLENuBlFUGZLlRKNUi2ecQ.text: I really love the view here and the drinks are pretty good. But the service is so bad it takes away any positive stars they would of had. I think they must just want to own a bar and don't really care about the food ? I am not really sure but for views and drinks go ahead and check it out. Stay away from the food that area needs a ton of work in order to be a solid place. I'd go back to get a drink though.

Q8UgygpH7Nb9NS3Brwm7jQ.text: Highly recommend having your event here. We just hosted an event here and they did a wonderful job. The event coordinator did a great job getting everything set up and planned before with my wife. The server who helped the day of was great. This was our family's 3rd event at the Watershed and we'll be having more here in the future.

yHW9cLjY1RBwirJFXUiV1Q.text: Food was a bit disappointed. But cruise was refreshing. Not so sure whether coming back in future or not because everything was soooooo slow

photos.caption: Photo of The Watershed - Tempe, AZ, United States

_BYu52-BQah3DjEkdWIeGQ.text: I very much enjoyed my experience at the Watershed. The GM, Heather, went above and beyond to make us feel warm, welcome, and taken care of. Will be back soon!

Mrhq-DsvG3HYfgJgMS5wEg.text: One of the best building and surrounding areas you could ask for in AZ, but very poorly managed! We keep going back for the convenience (it's within walking distance of our house) and for the scenery.  One of the times we went we sat at the bar and listened to a waitress complain for about an hour about having to cut ginger, which she was cutting on the bar that everyone was drinking at. I've felt every meal we've had there wasn't that great and was very overpriced.

BJ7OtZE9u6E0EL_Wgqd1ow.text: Terrible overall - food, service and attitude.  We've been to this restaurant at least 4-5 times over the past year or so...each time a problem with poor service and issues with getting the wrong order, food being served cold, etc., but like the waterside dining so kept saying let's give it another chance, especially when we heard it was under new management.  What a mistake, from being told the empty tables on the patio deck were reserved (yet no one was seated at them for the entire 1.5 hours we were there), to the tri tip on bun with a small amount of fatty meat - served cold as was the tiny serving of "au jus" which was more like slightly flavored water), to not receiving the 2nd entree until about 45 minutes after the first person was served, and then only after walking inside to find someone who could find out where our food was...to a waitress claiming we only ordered one entree (for 2 people), to being told by 3 people that they would send the manager over to our table - when we kept saying we didn't need to see a manager, we just wanted the rest of our food order...to the manager who finally showed up being condescending and not even offering to comp our food, or at least the 2 glasses of wine...ugh! I hate to write a bad review, don't recall ever doing so, but enough is enough and until/unless this place offers more than a lovely waterfront view I cannot see how they stay in business.

duC4b424rXIZqdZSPG0z6A.text: Great place. Fun atmosphere great happy hour nice staff.. What can I say you GOTTA go..

IV4ULrp8xYbe-AThfYM3_A.text: Sometimes things are so wrong that it is nearly unbelievable and that would describe my experience at The Watershed.  Service was the worst I've experienced in a very long time...gorgeous setting but, food was barely mediocre and the restaurant suffered from extremely poor management.  This HUGE restaurant has a total of 3 high chairs so, our day started badly since 2 of the 3 chairs were being used and we had two babies with us.  20 minutes went by, so I went inside and asked them to send us a server...5 minutes later he showed up and took our drink and appetizer order...we should have run then.  It took another 10 minutes before the drinks arrived.  Oh, did I say the appetizer failed to ever appear?  It took nearly an hour before our food arrived...no kidding.  No silverware...no appetizer...virtually no service and to add insult, the food was nothing special at all.  It's not hard to see the problem--horribly weak leadership, failure to be connected to the community (it was Santa day on the island and predictably busier than usual), poor training of host and serving staff, no available kid's menu, no silverware, well, it was basically a whole lot of nothing that cost $51.  I spoke to the manager and expressed our displeasure and to his credit he offered us a gift certificate for future use, but frankly it doesn't deserve a 2nd try.  He should have comp'd the meal or at least discounted it, but nope--oh, that would be another nothing which describes our experience.  Shame on them on so many levels...stay far away.

N9CLxvOhiRBuJL7oDRWKrw.text: I hope these guys get it going....lots of potencial ...menu leaves you asking for direction..waiter says I'll bring a beer menu...why not just have it with you or on the table rather then waiting?...ordered enchiladas which were very good(a little over priced) had to ask for salsa as did the guy behind me for his fish tacos?..beer is overpriced but maybe "ok" at happy hour... Cesare salad had potencial but doused with chili powder and with added shimp the size of a pinky finger...?...anyway.....hope they dont just rest on the location as that alone wont do it...BIG place inside..

KA50KgnWSFfuvFtd1xUo3A.text: Disappointed.   Positive: lovely building-clean and modern.  Beautiful views.  Had hoped to sit outside but there  wasn't enough shade covering.   Negative:  food was just O.K.   My husbands salmon was very small, my son and his wife said their meals were OK only.  My salad was very bland, hardly any dressing however the shrimp on top were done very nicely.  I ordered one of their house drinks but the waitress came back and said they didn't have all the ingredients to make it.  Really? A signature drink?  We ordered desert and wanted both a hot tea and a coffee to have with it.  No hot tea available.  My husbands coffee didn't arrive until after desert. She said they had to make some.  The cup was only 2/3rds full.  Waitress said she wouldn't charge him for it as it took so long but the charge was on the bill.  We were looking forward to going here because of the anticipated ambiance by the lake.  So sad we won't be going back now.

KJjeOWGHOMlKTI3wIiiNzQ.text: The place was very nice inside and outside. Two of us ordered the ribs and they were the saltest ribs I had ever tasted, The slaw was also very salty along with the french fries, I felt like i just washed my mouth out with salt water. We mentioned it to the waitress but she did not do anything. We won't be backj

_k50golbqxtXGgN-86SnuQ.text: I live in the neighborhood and have read the online reviews and decided to venture in for the first time over the weekend with a few friends.  Very impressive views of the water and an awesome outdoor seating area.  It was raining when we went, so we sat indoors.  Everyone from the hostess to the servers were very friendly and sincere.  Started with a cocktail and ended up ordering dinner.  I had the beef tacos with beans and rice.  Wife had enchiladas.  All was good except the rice was crunchy (undercooked).  Other than that, we really had a great time.  The G.M. stopped by our table to ask how everything was and asked if there was anything they could do better. An obvious nod to some of the "less than stellar" online/Yelp reviews.  Big kudos to him for taking the time to ask.  Lastly, note that this place is still being worked on and is not a "finished product" yet.  I look forward to returning and wish The Watershed lots of success!

LIZ5GjUlm2GoOHTi6gZyrQ.text: Stopped by for after-movie beverages. 2nd time here. Amazing atmosphere, incredible beer selection, and friendly staff. Bryan was our server; he was knowledgeable and helpful. This place is on the rise. We will be back!

7o6EeW2-5tkR_-GPJyCHpg.text: The food is fantastic,.. The queso fundido is the best along with the enchiladas I had.  Even the meat loaf is excellent. This place could stand alone just with the food but it has a beautiful view too.

Mry4edcJNOF1wye67L38UA.text: We were here for a retirement party. We called a couple weeks in advance to let them know that we would be there with about seventy to one hundred people and wanted to have the party on their patio (which was supposed to have misters since this was Arizona in late may and already reaching 100). When we got there in the afternoon the place was completely dead so we began to meet up in the bar area. About 10 minutes later they told us we had to go outside (despite the fact that there was nobody else there. When we got outside we found our selves on the side patio with no sprinkers. By time we wanted to order we found out that the had one waitress assigned to our group which was about eighty people (despite the fact that we had called ahead to book our party). We ordered and it took on average 45 minutes to get our food and our drinks arrived just before the food. Our waitress was nice but there was no excuse for how they mismanaged the situation.  The food was only okay, some orders never came and all we were told was that they "must not have been entered into the system" and we had to remind them to give us silverware. I would not go back here again. Horrible service and sub-par food.

zW1raR-NgPW2jzcGp105zA.text: Gorgeous setting!  Yummy appetizers and fun drinks.  We brought our teenagers and they loved the outdoor darts and picnic tables overlooking the water.  Our daughter want to bring friends for her birthday dinner.  Yes to the fish bites and green chili fries!

9gURYOJdqpXJ40d8NwM4Ow.text: I've been 3 times now becasue its close to home and very comfortable and the food and drinks were really good. So we thought stopping in on Valentines Day would be okay for a quick drink and bite to eat. NOT!  Get there at 5:20ish, only a few couples on the patio (20% capacity).  The hostess stops us and askes if we have a reservation, I responded "No", she then said it would be a few minutes.  Ok.  The place is practically empty, it's been 10 min, a waitress we had the week before says sorry to us and that she's not sure why we can't be seated.  Other couples walk in, no reservations as well and hostess tells them it will be a few minutes.  She then looks at me and says it'll be awhile, what happened to a few minutes?  Did I mention the place is practically empty?  No bar, still being built and can't even get drinks to wait.  I send my boyfriend next door to Pier 54 (which we frequent alot) to look for an empty table, which he calls to tell me he finds.  I then look at hostess to tell her not to bother, we have a table next door adn walk out.  We end up having a lovely evening on the water, live music and Great Service.  Not sure why the Watershed hostess was rude and doesn't know how to organize the timimng of occupants to tables.  She kept saying everything was reserved.  Sitting next door, we watched the onslaught of reservations for the Watershed arrive only for them to not find parking and it was close to 6:30pm.  We could have been in and out in that one hour.  I've had other resurants inform us their busy, but we could have a table if we finished before the next reservation time.  No such thing offered here.  It's back to Pier 54, who is reliable and hires qualified staff.

j2o9fGQAmR7y10qgEf3WAw.text: I got a coupon in the letter and that is how I found out about this place. It is very close and looked interesting so I tried it out. It was happy hour so we ordered a couple things off the menu. The waiter came back and forth 2 times to let us know that the menu item we chose were out. They were kind enough to give us a free menu item because of the blunder. I don't mind that part much but the food was not very good. I had fish tacos, which had fried fish balls. It was dry, fishy and tasted like it was frozen. It came on 2 layers of very greasy corn tortillas. The beans and rice on the side were mediocre. The free food, which was back ribs, was not very good either. It tasted gamey and just smothered in sauce. I will say they have the best cole slaw I have ever had. Instead of being super mayo-y, it tasted fresh, unique, almost like vinaigrette, and I loved it. I guess I am giving one star for the cole slaw, and one star for the nice view. Unfortunately, I know I won't be coming back.

IMQgTVKhcbx2oAFNlit-UA.text: Only two tables occupied yet refused service because 'only one waitress'... Didn't make sense but trying not to read too much into it.

rJ3vXclKguKgMd8cHpRrBw.text: Ok today is Feb 6  I gave them my address on Jan 21 still have not rec'd anything in the mail in regards to giving their restaurant another try. So at this point I don't want to give them another try.

LPY58ra919MfxEdvqvwkZg.text: Visiting The Watershed we found that the food was enjoyable but nothing specifically exciting.  We ordered chicken fejitas and green enchiladas.  I was disappointed to find that the chicken in each was the from the same recipe just with different additional items.  The chicken just didn't have the expected southwestern kick.  Noting the other reviews, we thought the service might be a risk but while there we found the service to be excellent.  In addition, the atmosphere was relaxed and comfortable when we were there for lunch on Saturday.  There was live music in the bar, but we were not too impressed and chose to sat in the dining room.

dW8u4_x8cuZDGfJUQc5EsA.text: The food was a bar type, we expected a little better menu.

D1QzBod3Q_ViOEzlGjAKig.text: What a great atmosphere for a place in Tempe. If you haven't gone here yet, its the best place in Tempe to eat outside. My girlfriend and I love it here. Great outside patio and a HUGE inside bar. Great beer selection and great house drinks...the hurricane is awesome and so its the sangria!! If you have a perfect AZ weather day, treat yourself to this awesome place!!!

GexiF5GOZ0zRK4IKkhW57A.text: My friends and I were so excited to try this place for breakfast, because the location and view is just stunning. We got there  at 9:00 AM when they opened and when they unlocked the door and let us in you could tell they were annoyed, they didn't greet us or anything. It didn't seem that anyone was ready for customers, coffee wasn't brewed the only thing ready was water. After we ordered another table was seated, fast forward 45 minutes that table had their food while we still did not.We had to ask for refills on our beverages multiple times which also took much longer than it should have. The food was average, not good enough to makeup for the service or overall experience. The restaurant was not busy at all (employees were sitting at the bar talking), in the 2 hours we were there we were one 4-5 tables really no excuse for the service we had. As if all this wasn't disappointing enough the bathrooms were filthy, they had not been cleaned from the night before. Very unpleasant visit, we won't be back to try again.

Ysha_EYg3SNuIvfw0Q4Meg.text: Ate there for the first time and will not go back.  Service was exceptional from both our waiter and the entire staff; however, our meals left a lot to be desired.  We tried some appetizers which were good and menu items looked interesting.  My wife barely ate her chicken fajitas (chicken was cold and dry, veges were overcooked and soggy, side of beans tasted like they were from a can).  Sister-in-law had soft tacos which were mediocre at best.   I had a New Mexican dish per recommendation of our server and it was average at best.  Bar area was packed.  My guess is if you go for drinks and appetizers you will enjoy this place.  Management need to upgrade quality of entre's.  Sent an email via Facebook of our experience and never heard a word back.

9SDXedaLDmitakdoyurpyA.text: The view is the only redeeming thing about this place.  We made a reservation on line through Yelp, which worked great.  When we arrived, we were greeted by a surly hostess and we informed her that our reservation was at 6:30 (time was 6:24).  She said "we will seat you right at 6".  There was no one in the place and no one waiting!  We stood awkwardly in the lobby for 6 minutes and she took us to our lakeside table.  Great setting!  The waiter took our drink order while we waited for our friends.  Four times in about ten minutes, random waiters showed up with drinks for other people.  Do they have any kind of system?  We ordered pretzels and cheese.  "Cheese" is over-microwaved cheese whiz with stale pretzels.  We had to ask for plates, napkins and silverware and waited ten minutes to receive.  The drinks were all tasty.  We ordered fish and chips, a burger and ribs.  The burger was good, ribs so-so and fish and chips arrived stone cold after 45 minute wait.  The waiter took back the fish and chips, where I am certain they re-fried the same pieces and brought them back hot, but overcooked and chewy. Fries were soggy.  Our friends were nearly done eating when we got our food.   Waiter offers free desert vs. any kind of comp on the meal--very lame.  The restaurant was half empty for most of the night, but the bar was very lively.  This appears to be a 30-something neighborhood scene and probably great if all you want is a cocktail.  I sadly cannot recommend for a meal.

XlQcRHxGATMwTfIY8tVUsw.text: This place is awesome! I love the patio. I can't wait until it is fully finished.

JMP0EmmBp3H6JNIfWEw4ww.text: Got a 2 for 1 entre coupon in the mail so decided to check the place out. We sat inside by a window and had an incredible view of the water. Would love to sit out on their patio later in the night when it's a little cooler. Our server was Cass and she was so knowledgeable and sweet. She was able to provide great suggestions for both food and drinks. We discovered it was happy hour and all of their specialty cocktails are only $5 along with drafts, wines by the glass, and a bunch of food options. Definitely one of the better happy hours I've seen. I tried the ginger margarita and it was great. The ginger made it a little extra refreshing. My boyfriend had the new old fashioned and enjoyed it as well. We ordered the spinach artichoke dip on happy hour, I ordered the Mediterranean wrap, and my boyfriend had a burger. Everything was as delicious as Cass had promised. So glad we got the coupon and had the chance to check this place out!

JKBxn0Vyd4PxT0O8PDrgLA.text: so I was trying to set up a Birthday dinner for my wife. Had a party of 15 adults. I was told by the young girl who answered the phone they don't do reservations at this time, not even for a bigger group! Hmmm...  Not sure if I'm starting a new business I turn away a possible $600-$700 food/bar tab! I understand your inside isn't finished but if you tell me that on a Thursday there shouldn't be a problem with a group that size then just reserve for me so when guest arrive before my wife and I they have somewhere to sit!

WsksEAO-ZSZcM9jPkIeOgg.text: Came here during the sunset. My friend and I sat outside to enjoy the view (what a view!) And the sunset. Our server Lora (forgive my spelling) was very attentive to our needs and had a very welcoming demeanor. It was my first time here and I have lived in Tempe for 15 years! It's truly a gem and will be coming back!

jPfpIR3cgF2JUpJxzTacaA.text: Not real impressed.   We decided on a date night and made the mistake of sitting at the bar thinking we would actually get halfway decent service...   Bartender / Barbacks are slack. Dirty glassware left in front of us after we had to request to order a couple of cocktails. Asked twice for a couple of dinner menus - given only one drink menu. Then we asked for a couple of waters. How do they manage to run out of the cucumber mix for one of their signature cocktails (the Lighthouse) in the middle a holiday weekend?  The Huevos Rancheros - since when does that dish mean a plate full of french fires ("dusted potatoes" as the menu says) covered in green chile sauce and a couple of eggs?  My spouse requested to see the manager - Mark.  There were no beans in the dish - even though according to him there were a "few in there". So, after a request for  additional beans then did the dish seem actually like something other than green chili covered plate-o-fires.  The Monte Cristo would have been a better tasting sandwich if it was more than "Texas Sized" bread with hardly any meat inside the actual sandwich.  For the price of the dish - try putting some actual meat inside it.    It would also be a good idea if the bartender had a clue about the food items actually listed on the menu.  Ours did not.    We had visited this establishment earlier in the week - Kelsea was a wonderful server.  So, that is why we are not listing our experiences at only one star.  Kelsea was courteous and attentive to us.  Sadly, the crab cakes were more "filler" than crab meat.  Perhaps I am spoiled from the Maryland Crab Cakes I am accustomed to from the east coast - but again, more corn meal than crab.   Sadly, while this location has a great amount of appeal and we do wish to give our business to locally owned and operated entrepreneurs, we would have been better off and had a better dining experience at an Outback or Red Lobster.

NyGPf0_D9ZUacmjY4Zk1RQ.text: My wife and I just finished lunch at The Watershed. Her grilled cheese sandwich with multiple cheeses, sauteed onions and mushrooms and my Monte Cristo sandwich were excellent! The huge glass wall offered a gorgeous view of the lake.  The service was very attentive and the manager was very accommodating.  We will be back with friends!

BO2RABjPTOgK31LqXw3dnw.text: Gross. Worst enchiladas ever. Disgusting. The bruschetta was equally gross. Expensive, wait for food was long.

1EO4lzaDCAxYxpNWW6gAUw.text: We had a fantastic Father's Day meal at The Watershed. We had a party of 9, so lots of different meals were eaten. I had the tenderloin with potatoes and asparagus. It was truly delicious!  Service was excellent, even with our big group. We all left feeling very happy with our experience.  We will definitely make The Watershed a regular place for family gatherings.

akg39WlmuSw86V2Bxc-Elg.text: Great place! Was a bit skeptical after reading some of the other reviews but it was great! We had the shrimp penne pasta and the grilled cheese. Both were amazing. The coleslaw that they have as a side was so unique and very delicious. We had carrot cake for dessert- it was alright. Kind of dry. They were also out of Sauvignon Blanc which was a bummer. It was dark while we were there but the view was still beautiful. You don't feel like you're in the desert. Highly recommend this place!

5jZlNQG1merTZsajy-PPzA.text: Great atmosphere! Service was attentive and friendly. Ordered enchiladas, very nice. Defiantly be back soon.

ZYrLM3fwPcOYePWxsyg9og.text: sever was great as were host staff..no wait time, even though we requested a table change.  Serving time a tad longer then we like, but not bad. Food : fish and chips were great..other entrees marginal appetizers average. May suggest list spicy or minor spicy (mother in law got the Sheppard's pie and the beef was to spicy for her. View amazing

FytiVN9x3KG3HM2h5UYSsw.text: The one thing that is first and foremost about any type of dining establishment is People, hey, that's what I am, a person, and I'm betting that's what you are too! So, if the people are made of good stuff, well that equals service, its there, in people, like you and like me; rather you feel it or not on your sometimes limited lst time experience. people=service=profit! None of my concern, profit! But I really get the people and service thing; and thousands like me get it to, cause that's the experience you'll get every time when step into the dining experience at the Watershed, I mean good food, good music, oh, and good people. It's ambience experience is matched by none south of Frank Lloyd. Right in your backyard! its like your hometown bar away from your hometown!

u_iu9k-Q4qCZjrrxzoJy8Q.text: My first time there was with friends during a monsoon down pour. The building and view of the lake both before and during the storm were great. We sat at the bar and Mike took very good care of us. Good selection of brews and the appetizers were tasty as well.  Looks like a GREAT place for a large group. The vaulted ceilings and open floor plan, coupled with the water view did transport us from "scotching desert" to "waterside". And then the live band kicked in. Definitely going back.

hL_9oPV5O0OcjakYuEEySQ.text: Heard of this place from friends at work! Gave it a shot I'm new in town so enjoying finding new places. Their salmon pasta is beyond amazing along with their fish tacos! The service was great and really enjoyed the ambiance of it all. I've heard the happy hour is good haven't Been there for that yet. The domestic beers were a tad pricey but in all I enjoyed myself as well as the dinner!

2OWMIfy11MXv7sd_XFsKfw.text: I took my family to the Watershed for brunch for a Pre-Mother's Day celebration and it was perfect. The set up for brunch was perfect and there is so many choices of delicious food! Not to mention we enjoyed a beautiful and relaxing boat ride after brunch, courtesy from Zack. The prices are good and the food is great! I recommend anyone to try out this beautiful location and enjoy some great food.

dDjbYeztIfhGSgV8iRLlZw.text: Went for dinner to check out this place ! The view of the lake is amazing ! It's a shame that the inside of this restaurant is boring . The wait staff is polite but needs more training . The food is overpriced and the menu is limited. The only reason I gave this place 3 stars is because the fish & chips I had was actually very good. Well at least you have an amazing view while you ponder over their limited menu !

lTK2Tf1Dv7FszGNFXfjMFQ.text: Today was my first time going to this restaurant and the only positive thing I can say is the patio area had a nice view. The most upsetting part is this is where we chose to eat on Easter, the kids were excited about a boat ride that we called in advance to make sure would be operating on Easter and were assured they would be.Yet, once there, we were told no rides were being offered because the manager wasn't there due to a sick child at home. Are you kidding me? A holiday and no other management? The food was at best decent and I found them to be pricey. A family of 4 was $82 not including tip for breakfast and drinks. Also I asked for a cup of coffee, waited ten minutes and was brought out a dirty cup that was less than half filled. My husband ordered a burrito and asked to sub out the bacon for tri tip. Well he gets his burrito and they put in bacon. By the time they remade it the rest of us were done eating our meals. To make it worse he asked for green sauce and they put red sauce, then they must have caught the mistake and poured green sauce over it instead of fixing their second mistake. I asked for an extra side of salsa for my meal and instead was given none at all. Had to wait once I asked the server and was almost done with my omelette before getting it. No offers or discounts were given for our terrible visit and of course no management to speak to about all the complications. Unfortunately IHop would have been a much better dining option. Beyond disappointing.

yco-IG0yjtC_RdevAJHYzA.text: This restaurant is amazing, great ambiance, view and food!  Casual atmosphere with food and hand crafted cocktails. The wings and pretzel bites are a favorite!!

rwACBD9xlnVQ5WUINWbQXA.text: Totally underwhelmed by our first visit here. Slightly embarrassed as we took friends visiting from out of state here. Food was fair. I was afraid it would be cold for as long as it took to get it. They were not that busy for the wait we had with server to get us the bill. We were actually ready to get up an go find him. I guess we were anticipating more since they have been open for awhile to get kinks out. Looks like construction is still going on. I will be hesitant to return.

4Yuv2cJzQpWg1AClw3wSwA.text: the restaurant itself is very nice and clean. it's right on the lake, and it has a great patio and bar area. I was in a group of 6 people, and we were seated outside. it was pretty, but I wish they had misters and a big umbrella bc the sun was either right in your eyes or on the back of your neck. our waiter was helpful and nice, and made a point of checking up on us every 15-20 minutes and refilling drinks. however, the food took forever (about 35 minutes) and we were there on a Sunday evening. the food was okay. I had the portobello sandwich which was quite small and it came out cold. my boyfriend had the fish tacos and they were also cold. we would have gone on one of the boat rides that they offer, however the battery was dead by the time we were ready to go, which I figured would have been the redeeming quality of the evening. they gave us about 10 free boat tickets. I would suggest going during happy hour to watch a game and load up on appetizers (which were all very good!) then do a boat ride around the lakes. not sure if I would visit again if we didn't have the boat tickets.

TvD7L0J6w8YSG4kBCw93Tg.text: Drinks were great. Lake atmosphere was beautiful but service was slow and food was meh. I had tacos, husband had burger. Nothing was bad but it wasn't great either. Would definitely go back for drinks /happy hour when it's not so hot out. Patio is nice and it's not filled with smokers like pier 54 is right next door.

iqy271l3gTGmgluAz9DyXQ.text: Service was slow so we only stayed for appetizers. They weren't busy so not sure what the hold up was. I got the ceviche which was OK. They had cucumber slices that I used instead of chips so that was nice. My bf got the pretzel bits and said they were really good. I'll go back and try them again. The location was really nice and chill.

4DZ7Ab5oTt_UUo7t8dT4Uw.text: What a great evening! Delicious well prepared food, a lovely lakeside outdoor setting, friendly welcoming service, and two great musicians playing oldies and their original songs. Special shout out to our server Laura who was conscientious , personable, and went above and beyond to make our visit enjoyable. Also kudos to chef James who not only accommodated my restrictive diet but came out to discuss my options and delivered a meal that met the restrictions but was also delicious: sirloin steak cooked perfectly, garlic spinach and a baked potato (that most chefs don't do any more because it's way off menu). My husband recommends his shrimp Alfredo and the Frozen strawberry daiquiri.

zgwTt7oa80Rs-vkR5QTgag.text: My husband and I went here for an afternoon drink and was very pleased. The inside was very nice . We sat outside on the deck which was an amazing atmosphere. The service was very prompt and our waitress was great . We had the queso fun dido which was delicious. They had a great selection of draft beer as well.

WS7AakbM97q3B-cPLOvZnA.text: We rolled in with a group of 20+ and the staff was immediately accommodating and welcoming. They quickly moved tables on the beautiful patio so we would be shaded and together. The drinks were good and had a nice pour. We ordered a bunch of appetizers, my faves were the chicken skewers and the guac was good too. Everything was fresh and the service was spectacular! We will be back for sure, I'm so glad we got denied service at Pier 54 and ended up here!!

Ix3aAb2LBJIh-9DkjV_lGg.text: Came for happy hour to sit on the patio, place was empty and there was not even any music. The food was okay nothing special. They didn't have the cocktail I ordered, the one I ended up getting wasn't so great. Probably won't come back.

Gs-iHtb2YYhkx_jfzV8Y1w.text: I don't want to write this review, because I always want to be able to get a good spot on the patio for happy hour. The fewer people that know about this place, the better my odds! My first visit here was for a wedding on the patio. There was something so beautiful and magical about the bride and groom arriving to the ceremony by boat, and watching the sunset over the water certainly added to the experience. The food was buffet style Mexican - and quite tasty. I went back for a happy hour with my sister. The margaritas and sangrias were a great compliment to a warm spring day. The weather on the patio was perfect - and having a cocktail while watching another sunset on the water was just as peaceful, beautiful and enchanting as it had been for the wedding. We didn't have much by way of food. A couple of orders of wings, fries, and guacamole. I think they were all good. Honestly, they may have been mediocre, but with fantastic company and this setting, they would have tasted great no matter what. The staff is friendly and laid back, and I am thrilled to have a waterfront happy hour just minutes from my office. Perfect mini-vacation. This will definitely be on my regular rotation!

wxZTB4_CYjST3yp1xNJ02Q.text: 3 and a half stars.  Nice place to eat by the water. Visiting from California. The brunch buffet was good and mimosas were too. We will go back if ever in Tempe again.

xGYrsHJXmFGqTCYhzixIAw.text: The Watershed has a lot of potential with its cool location and layout. Right now it is far from where it needs to be.
